title: Wintertodt/Warm clothing

properties.name: description
properties.value: Throughout the fight, the player will take intermittent passive damage as the cold of the Wintertodt begins to seep into their bones. This passive damage is scaled to each player's levels, based on the sum of the player's Hitpoints and Firemaking levels as well as the number of braziers that are currently lit. Wearing warm or winter-themed equipment will reduce the damage taken.

content:
Throughout the fight, the player will take intermittent passive damage as the cold of the Wintertodt begins to seep into their bones. This passive damage is scaled to each player's levels, based on the sum of the player's Hitpoints and Firemaking levels as well as the number of braziers that are currently lit. Wearing warm or winter-themed equipment will reduce the damage taken.

A minimum of four of these warm items need to be equipped to receive the maximum damage-reduction.

Most of these items were listed in a Dev Q&A with Mod Kieren on 6 October 2016. This list also includes items that were not listed during that Q&A, but were later verified to act as warm clothing.

Contents

  • 1 Outfits
    • 1.1 Santa outfit
    • 1.2 Antisanta outfit
    • 1.3 Bunny outfit
    • 1.4 Clue hunter outfit
    • 1.5 Hunter gear
    • 1.6 Bomber jacket costume
    • 1.7 Yak-hide armour
    • 1.8 Pyromancer outfit
    • 1.9 Chicken outfit
    • 1.10 Evil chicken outfit
  • 2 Head slot
  • 3 Neck slot
  • 4 Hands slot
  • 5 Cape slot
  • 6 Weapon slot
  • 7 Shield slot
  • 8 Body slot
  • 9 Ring slot
  • 10 Non-warm ambiguous clothing

Note: You will likely want to have an axe equipped rather than using the weapon slot for a piece of warm gear, unless it's a bruma torch.

Non-warm ambiguous clothing[edit | edit source]

None of the items below provide warmth protection in Wintertodt. Out of the items listed above, gloves of silence were the only items not listed in the original Q&A. Other than these items that work as warm clothing, there are several items that might be assumed to act as warm clothing, which do not actually work. These are:

Non-warming items
Spotted cape
Spottier cape
Strung rabbit foot
Tri-jester hat
Woolly hat
Bobble hat
Cap and goggles
Earmuffs
